remedies.name: Peaceful Evening Tea
remedies.description: A gentle, calming blend perfect for unwinding after a long day or preparing for restful sleep.
instructions: Combine all herbs in a tea strainer or teapot
Pour 8 oz of just-boiled water over the herbs
Cover and steep for 5-10 minutes (longer for stronger effect)
Strain and enjoy warm
Optional: Add honey to taste
tips: Drink 30-60 minutes before bed for sleep support
Covering while steeping preserves volatile oils
Can be made as a larger batch and reheated
variations: Add a small piece of fresh ginger for warmth
Include passionflower for enhanced sleep support
Add a sprig of fresh mint for a refreshing twist
remedies.safety: Generally safe. Avoid chamomile if allergic to ragweed. May enhance sedative medications.

remedies.name: After Dinner Digestive Tea
remedies.description: A classic blend to ease digestion, relieve bloating, and settle the stomach after meals.
instructions: Lightly crush the fennel seeds to release oils
Combine all herbs in a tea strainer or small pot
If using fresh ginger, simmer in water for 5 minutes first
Pour 8 oz of hot water over the herbs
Cover and steep for 5-10 minutes
Strain and sip slowly after meals
tips: Can be made stronger for acute digestive upset
Fresh ginger is more warming than dried
variations: Include a small amount of licorice root for sweetness
Add fresh lemon juice for extra digestive support
remedies.safety: Avoid peppermint if you have GERD or acid reflux. Ginger may affect blood-thinning medications in large amounts.

remedies.name: Classic Elderberry Syrup
remedies.description: The quintessential immune-support syrup. Take daily during cold and flu season or increase frequency at first sign of illness.
instructions: Combine elderberries, ginger, cinnamon, and cloves in a pot with water
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer uncovered for 45 minutes to 1 hour
Liquid should reduce by about half
Remove from heat and let cool until warm (not hot)
Mash the berries to release remaining juice
Strain through a fine mesh strainer or cheesecloth, pressing to extract all liquid
Once cooled to warm temperature, stir in honey until dissolved
Pour into a clean glass jar and store in refrigerator
remedies.storage: Refrigerate for up to 3 months. Do not freeze (honey may crystallize).

dosage.prevention: Adults: 1 tablespoon daily. Children (1-12): 1 teaspoon daily
dosage.acute: Adults: 1 tablespoon every 2-3 hours. Children: 1 teaspoon every 2-3 hours

tips: Never consume raw elderberries - always cook them first
Add honey only after mixture has cooled to preserve its benefits
variations: Add echinacea root to the decoction for enhanced immune support
Include rose hips for extra vitamin C
Use maple syrup instead of honey for vegan version (shorter shelf life)
remedies.safety: Do not give honey to children under 1 year. Avoid elderberry with autoimmune conditions or if taking immunosuppressants.

remedies.name: Soothing Lavender Salve
remedies.description: A versatile healing salve for minor burns, cuts, scrapes, dry skin, and general skin soothing. The lavender provides calming aromatherapy as well.
instructions: TO MAKE INFUSED OIL (2-4 weeks ahead):
Fill a clean, dry jar 1/2 to 2/3 full with dried lavender flowers
Cover completely with olive oil, leaving 1 inch headspace
Stir to release air bubbles and ensure all plant material is submerged
Cap and place in a sunny window for 2-4 weeks, shaking daily
Strain through cheesecloth, squeezing to extract all oil
TO MAKE SALVE:
Combine infused oils in a double boiler or heat-safe jar in a pot of water
Add beeswax and heat gently until beeswax is completely melted
Remove from heat
Add essential oil and vitamin E if using
Quickly pour into clean tins or jars
Let cool completely before capping (1-2 hours)
Label with ingredients and date
remedies.storage: Store in a cool, dark place for up to 1 year. Discard if it smells rancid or changes color.
tips: Test consistency by putting a small amount on a cold plate - adjust beeswax if too soft/hard
More beeswax = firmer salve; less = softer
Ensure all equipment is completely dry to prevent mold
variations: Add tea tree essential oil for antimicrobial properties
Include chamomile for extra soothing effects
Use coconut oil for part of the base for a different texture
remedies.safety: For external use only. Patch test before widespread use. Do not apply to deep or infected wounds.

remedies.name: Fire Cider
remedies.description: A traditional warming tonic for immune support and circulation. Spicy, tangy, and invigorating - perfect for cold and flu season.
instructions: Add all ingredients except vinegar and honey to a quart jar
Pour apple cider vinegar over ingredients to fill jar, leaving 1 inch headspace
If using a metal lid, place parchment paper between lid and jar (vinegar corrodes metal)
Shake well to combine
Store in a cool, dark place for 4-6 weeks, shaking daily
Strain through cheesecloth, squeezing to extract all liquid
Add honey to taste, starting with 1/4 cup
Bottle and label with date
remedies.storage: Refrigerate for up to 1 year. The vinegar acts as a preservative.

dosage.prevention: 1-2 tablespoons daily, diluted in water or juice if desired
dosage.acute: 1 tablespoon every 2-3 hours at onset of illness

tips: Can be used as a salad dressing or marinade
The strained vegetables can be used in stir-fries
Adjust heat level by using more or fewer hot peppers
variations: Add echinacea root for enhanced immune support
Add astragalus root for deep immune building
remedies.safety: May cause heartburn in sensitive individuals. Avoid if taking blood thinners (contains garlic and ginger). Not recommended during pregnancy due to strong herbs.
